title: Otter Nonsense
text: The otter balances a pebble like a tiny crown. It twirls, drops it, and looks very pleased with itself.

title: A British Breeze
text: A small breeze hustles the leaves along the path. Clouds shuffle over the sun, then think better of it.

title: The Foxâ€™s Plan
text: The fox draws a map with a muddy paw, then forgets which way is north and asks a friendly crow.

title: Water Cycle
text: Water evaporates from the sea, forms clouds, and then falls as rain. It's a journey with no end.

title: The Griffin's Guard
text: The griffin, with its lion's body and eagle's head, guarded a treasure of pure gold. Few dared to challenge it.

title: Detective Badger
text: Badger put on his favourite tweed cap. 'The case of the missing jam tart,' he mumbled, 'is my most difficult yet!'

title: Hedgehog Defence
text: At the first sign of danger, the hedgehog curls into a tight, spiky ball. It is a simple but effective defence.

title: The Ancient Oak
text: An ancient oak tree stood on the hill, its branches like gnarled fingers pointing at the travelling clouds.

title: Pigeon Post
text: A pigeon tries to deliver a letter, but he gets distracted by a shiny bottle cap and forgets the address.

title: How Rainbows Form
text: Sunlight shining through raindrops is split into its different colours, creating a beautiful arc in the sky.

title: Bat Sonar
text: A bat navigates in the dark by emitting high-pitched squeaks. The echoes create a map of its surroundings.

title: Cerberus
text: Cerberus, the three-headed dog, guarded the entrance to the underworld. He was fearsome but loyal to his master.

title: Squirrel Meeting
text: The squirrels held an urgent meeting. The topic: how to get the 'impossible' nuts from the new bird feeder.

title: River's Journey
text: The river starts as a tiny trickle in the hills. It grows stronger and wider on its long journey to the sea.

title: The Chameleon
text: A chameleon can change its skin colour to match its background. It's the ultimate game of hide-and-seek.

title: Magnets
text: Every magnet has a north and a south pole. Opposite poles attract, while identical poles repel each other.

title: A Formal Frog
text: A frog insists on wearing a tiny bow tie. He thinks it makes him look more distinguished when catching flies.

title: Pegasus
text: Pegasus was a magnificent winged horse. With a beat of his hooves, he could create a spring of fresh water.

title: Spider's Web
text: The spider's web, a marvel of engineering, glistens with morning dew. It is both a home and a clever trap.

title: Clever Crows
text: Crows are incredibly intelligent birds. They can use tools, solve puzzles, and even remember human faces.

title: Barnaby's Big Idea
text: Barnaby had a brilliant, if silly, idea. He would learn to fly! He strapped two large cabbage leaves to his back and leapt from a small log. He did not fly, but he did perform a spectacular tumble.

title: The Dandelion Detective
text: One perfect dandelion was missing from the patch. Beatrice Bunny, detective extraordinaire, examined the scene. The only clue? A trail of crumbs leading straight to the sleepy badger's den.
